intro: Eremurus dolichomischus, commonly known as the long-stemmed eremurus, is a perennial plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Eremurus, which is part of the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the sunflower family. The plant is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Eremurus dolichomischus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to rocky or sandy soils.
